entries.title: analog life
entries.content:
What did we do before posting to MySpace, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, X?
Were we okay? 
Did we have no space to share?
Did we have no faces to bookmark?
Did we have no medium to share our thoughts?
Did we have no town square?
Was there life before digital?

entries.title: 🌐 .gov Websites
entries.content:
I can show you .gov websites without proper margins and padding. I could redesign their shitty websites for a nanofraction of the cost. But no, we have people convinced a "king" is the problem. 

 .gov websites are dysfunctional so we use corporations to index them when we could just compile all .gov into one giant JSON file with a public API. But no, we’ve dug in and procured ex-ABNB designer to make the shitty slop shiny for the suckers -  ignoring first principles.

entries.title: 🔋 Battery Ownership
entries.content: The value of an EV is the battery which is best realized as consumable amperage. As long as utilities and car companies have the moat on determinative electrons, EV cost per mile coupled with other ownership frictions ain’t consumable at this high price. It’s not even worth a Prius-pious conscience. Give me Waymo and legacy ICE at home with a full tank, hard steel, and a low premium ready to go fast and uninhibited. Fuck your subprime financing, the conformist design with digital dashboard slop. Fuck your market interventions, your ‘sector restructuring’ mandates, the CO2 activists with their abysmal emissions reductions. The price is wrong, bitches. Give me solid state. Give me control of my Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) so I can charge it with the sun. Otherwise I’m wrangling with Harrison Ford and my unadaptive American flag!

entries.title: 🔒 Authoritarianism > Vagrants
entries.content: Authoritarianism over vagrants anyday of the week. Lock them up. So sick of it. Since troops in D.C., homicides 23 to 8. Robberies down 54%, burglaries down 48%. Democrats indirectly embrace criminality as they speak softly AND carry no sticks.

entries.title: 📡 FCC's Byzantine Bureaucracy
entries.content: We're about to find out that the FCC operates in byzantine style much like the BLS. The public interest clause will soon be exposed as absurd and anachronistic.

entries.title: 🥩 Battle of the Institutes
entries.content: The Meat Institute says the meat is safe. The Anti-Meat Institute says it is not. The Institute of Medicine says the Medicine is safe. The Institute of Anti-Medicine says it is not. The Institute of International Peace says the war is not safe. The Institute of War says it is.

entries.title: 🙈 Define Terrorism
entries.content:
'When there is talk of hatred, let us stand up and talk against it. When there is talk of violence, let us stand up and talk against it.' - President Clinton

•'Famously difficult to define.' - Judge Gregory Carro
• Violently broadcasting a social and political message
• The calculated use of violence or the threat of violence to inculcate fear
• Intended to coerce or intimidate governments or societies
• Often motivated by political, religious, or ideological objectives
• Typically targets civilians or non-combatants
• Aims to create fear for political purposes
• The use of violence and intimidation in the pursuit of political aims
• An act of violence or threat that is intended to create fear in a population

entries.title: 🐇 rabbit hole
entries.content: The algorithm sends you down the rabbit hole to keep you engaged. When you get out, you realize it's nice and sunny above ground.

entries.title: 🛌 Sleep
entries.content: If I'm not getting sleep, it's because my circadian rhythm and BRAC (Basic Rest-Activity Cycle) are out of sync or I have something unresolved in my mind. It's not because of my mattress. Adhering to cycles and physical exhaustion from having woken up early, help my body know when to sleep and when to wake up. The solution for me so far? Waking up early and exercising to maintain a consistent sleep cycle. I refuse to spend $5,000 on a smart mattress pad.

entries.title: 🏠 The Priciest Home in America
entries.content: $300M estate in Aspen, CO. 74 acres, 27,426 sq ft, 18 beds, 24 baths, and a private lake. Check it out

entries.title: 🏥 The Hidden Costs of Healthcare
entries.content: Our healthcare system is broken, with insurance creating perverse incentives that inflate costs. A simple blood test panel costs $255 privately but $964 through insurance. The system discourages price shopping as patients only see minimal copays, while doctors are incentivized to order unnecessary tests. Even 'preventive care' often feels like a data collection scheme, with insurance companies offering small rewards for personal health data. The solution? More transparency and questioning whether each test or prescription is truly necessary. Read more

entries.title: 👥 Obsolescent Corpulence
entries.content: Sat next to a corpulent person on the plane. Went through stages of denial, anger, bargaining, sadness, and acceptance. Empathy (I'm in her shoes now). To lose fat, I need to regulate my blood sugar and appetite, reduce amyloid plaque and tangles of tau proteins, eat less (qualify that for me: what is processed? how much fiber? less carbs? more protein? intermittent fasting?), exercise more (10k steps is BS now? inclines? weights? frequently?) This is difficult. Live and think like a hunter gatherer? Okay, but I'm depressed, broke, and despondent. Take glucagon-like peptides (GLP-1)? Now we're talking 💰. Ask a doctor and the capital markets how they can make money off my fat ass. No exploitable free cash flow in a healthy neanderthal.

entries.title: 🏚️ Rent Control Market Distortions
entries.content: NYT states that 1M rent-controlled landlords net operating income was up 12.1% and that they're, 'actually doing pretty well.' Big thing missing. Just a major fact. Missing. Landlords costs are down because they're not investing in their properties. They aren't spending or are disclosing the smallest costs to justify whatever increases they can get under state control. State intervention will always have adverse market incentives. Remove the state and a Fair Market Rent and a Free Market system will fascilitate price discovery. Landlords will invest and tenants will get better deals. More compliance costs, more state intervention, and you get HIGHER PRICES.

entries.title: 🚙 Defender Dreams
entries.content: I want a Defender so I can drive on top of dunes and up streams to waterfalls and up steps to Tudor homes.

entries.title: 🌆 Nob Hill
entries.content:
Asian Man Black shoes
Rolls Royce Dusty top
Long shadows on a Friday night bench
An Acura parked long term. A tucked ticket.
Clipping heals to date night.
Gas engines purring from stop signs.
Wandering elderly man in sneakers, jeans, and a sweatshirt.
A crew, 'for me to be happy in the city…'
Sitting still is not easy.
The world passes you by and it's completely indifferent.
The sun feels nice and the cable cars creak; comfort in cacophony and cacophony in comfort.
A weird word. A weird world.
